bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218264]
[%Nr. 4646]
[!Schreibe die richtige Form in die erscheinende Lücke oben in der Mitte. Wenn du kein Wort einsetzen möchtest, dann tipp ein 'x'. Viel Spaß.]
||rewritten instruction||

Hello,

My name is Susan. I'm fo[_u]rteen and I li[_v]e in Germany. My hobb[_ie]s are go[_ing] to discos and jogging, sometimes I [_listen to] music [_on] the radio. In [_x] July I go swimming in a [_lake.] I haven't [_got] any brothers or sisters. We take bu[_s]es to sc[_h]ool. I [_attend] year 9 at my school. My birthday is on Friday. I hope I will [_get] a new guitar.
I'm looking forward to get[_ting] a[_n] e-mail from you.

Yours,
Susan

bit.body:
Hello,

My name is Susan. I'm fo{0}rteen and I li{1}e in Germany. My hobb{2}s are go{3} to discos and jogging, sometimes I {4} music {5} the radio. In {6} July I go swimming in a {7} I haven't {8} any brothers or sisters. We take bu{9}es to sc{10}ool. I {11} year 9 at my school. My birthday is on Friday. I hope I will {12} a new guitar.
I'm looking forward to get{13} a{14} e-mail from you.

Yours,
Susan
bit.instruction: Schreibe die richtige Form in die erscheinende Lücke oben in der Mitte. Wenn du kein Wort einsetzen möchtest, dann tipp ein 'x'. Viel Spaß.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218265]
[%Nr. 3910]
[!Setze die in Klammern stehenden Wörter in der richtigen Form in die Lücken ein. Achte darauf, ob die Sätze bejaht oder verneint sind.]

0. [_Open][@example] your books. __(to open)__
1. [_Go][!to go] upstairs.
2. [_Don't swim][!not/to swim] in this lake.
3. [_Do][!to do] your homework.
4. [_Don't play][!not/to play] football in the yard.
5. [_Brush][!to brush] your teeth.
6. [_Don't talk][!not/to talk] during the lesson. 
7. [_Don't feed][!not/to feed] the animals in the zoo.
8. [_Read][!to read] the instructions.
9. [_Don't be][!not/to be] late for school.
10. [_Switch off][!to switch off] your mobiles.

bit.body:
0. {0} your books. __(to open)__
1. {1} upstairs.
2. {2} in this lake.
3. {3} your homework.
4. {4} football in the yard.
5. {5} your teeth.
6. {6} during the lesson. 
7. {7} the animals in the zoo.
8. {8} the instructions.
9. {9} late for school.
10. {10} your mobiles.
bit.instruction: Setze die in Klammern stehenden Wörter in der richtigen Form in die Lücken ein. Achte darauf, ob die Sätze bejaht oder verneint sind.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218266]
[%Nr. 3912]
[!Setze die in Klammern stehenden Wörter in die Lücken ein. Achte darauf, ob die Sätze bejaht oder verneint sind.]

0. [_Listen][@example] to the dialogue. __(to listen)__
1. [_Ask][!to ask] your brother.
2. [_Don't use][!not/to use] a pencil.
3. [_Hurry][!to hurry] up.
4. [_Be][!to be] quiet.
5. [_Don't call][!not/to call] the police.
6. [_Make][!to make] your beds.
7. Please [_mind][!to mind] the gap.
8. [_Don't tell ][!not/to tell] dad about my accident. 
9. Please [_don't smoke][!not/to smoke] in this room. 
10. Let's [_help][!to help] her mother in kitchen.

bit.body:
0. {0} to the dialogue. __(to listen)__
1. {1} your brother.
2. {2} a pencil.
3. {3} up.
4. {4} quiet.
5. {5} the police.
6. {6} your beds.
7. Please {7} the gap.
8. {8} dad about my accident. 
9. Please {9} in this room. 
10. Let's {10} her mother in kitchen.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218267]
[%Nr. 3616]
[!Schreibe die kompletten Wortgruppen in das Simple Past.]

0. I listen → [_I listened][@example]
1. I play - [_I played]
2. we visit - [_we visited]
3. they like - [_they liked]
4. she dances - [_she danced]
5. you carry - [_you carried]
6. he stops - [_he stopped]
7. you change -[_you changed]
8. we enjoy - [_we enjoyed]
9. she uses - [_she used]
10. you try - [_you tried]

bit.instruction: Schreibe die kompletten Wortgruppen in das Simple Past.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218268]
[%Nr. 3618]
[!Schreibe die kompletten Wortgruppen noch einmal im **Simple Past.**]

0. she invents → [_she invented][@example]
1. we wash - [_we washed]
2. I arrive - [_I arrived]
3. they destroy - [_they destroyed]
4. you hurry - [_you hurried]
5. she elects - [_she elected]
6. you marry - [_you married]
7. we plan - [_we planned]
8. he discovers - [_he discovered]
9. they travel - [_they travelled]
10. I prefer - [_I preferred]

bit.instruction: Schreibe die kompletten Wortgruppen noch einmal im **Simple Past.**

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:218272]
[%Nr. 3440]
[!Entscheide, ob das **fettgedruckte Wort** im Satz ein Substantiv oder ein Verb ist.
Beachte die Endung __-s.__]

1. We read **books.** - [+Substantiv][-Verb]
2. She **rides** a horse. - [-Substantiv][+Verb]
3. My **parents** are nice. - [+Substantiv][-Verb]
4. They play the drums. - [+Substantiv][-Verb]
5. He often **helps** his brother. - [-Substantiv][+Verb]
6. Frank never **has** lunch at school. - [-Substantiv][+Verb]
7. I don't like **carrots**. - [+Substantiv][-Verb]
8. Her **friends** live in a flat. - [+Substantiv][-Verb]
9. John often **gets up** late. - [-Substantiv][+Verb]
10. Peggy comes home from school at 3.30 pm. - [-Substantiv][+Verb]

bit.instruction:
Entscheide, ob das **fettgedruckte Wort** im Satz ein Substantiv oder ein Verb ist.
Beachte die Endung __-s.__

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218273]
[%Nr. 4668]
[!Schreibe in die **erste Lücke** das Verb mit der **Endung -s** und in die **zweite Lücke** das Verb mit der **Endung -ing.** Beachte das Beispiel.]

0. open → [_opens][@example] → [_opening][@example]
1. cook - [_cooks] - [_cooking]
2. play - [_plays] - [_playing]
3. sit - [_sits] - [_sitting]
4. make - [_makes] - [_making]
5. go - [_goes] - [_going]
6. write - [_writes] - [_writing]
7. watch - [_watches] - [_watching]
8. try - [_tries] - [_trying]
9. push - [_pushes] - [_pushing]
10. have - [_has] -[_having]

bit.instruction: Schreibe in die **erste Lücke** das Verb mit der **Endung -s** und in die **zweite Lücke** das Verb mit der **Endung -ing.** Beachte das Beispiel.

[%Nr. 4014]
[!Schreibe die richtige Verbform in die Lücke. Benutze das **Simple Present.**]

0. I swim → she [_swims][@example]
1. I sing - she [_sings]
2. I play - she [_plays]
3. I read - she [_reads]
4. I go - she [_goes]
5. I ask - she [_asks]
6. I carry - she [_carries]
7. I enjoy - she [_enjoys]
8. I wash - she [_washes]
9. I call - she [_calls]
10. I cry - she [_cries]

1. I help - he [_helps]
2. I watch - he [_watches]
3. I do - he [_does]
4. I tidy - he [_tidies]
5. I can - he [_can]
6. I say - he [_says]
7. I walk - he [_walks]
8. I pass - he [_passes]
9. I must - he [_must]
10. I hurry - he [_hurries]

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:218276]
[%Nr. 3422]
[!Entscheide, ob das **fettgedruckte Wort** im Satz ein Substantiv oder ein Verb ist.]

1. I **like** your computer. - [-Substantiv][+Verb]
2. We live in a small **town.** - [+Substantiv][-Verb]
3. They **play** handball. - [-Substantiv][+Verb]
4. His **friend** has a pet. - [+Substantiv][-Verb]
5. I **go** to bed at 9 o'clock. - [-Substantiv][+Verb]
6. My **bedroom** is upstairs. - [+Substantiv][-Verb]
7. Let's **listen** to this CD. - [-Substantiv][+Verb]
8. Sam and Tom **watch** TV. - [-Substantiv][+Verb]
9. They swim in a lake. - [-Substantiv][+Verb]
10. I always feed my **hamster.** - [+Substantiv][-Verb]

bit.instruction: Entscheide, ob das **fettgedruckte Wort** im Satz ein Substantiv oder ein Verb ist.
